content:
I am interested in deep learning methods with a focus on relational representations and graph neural networds. I studied at University Politehnica of Bucharest, where I obtained a Bachelor's degree and a Master's degree in Artificial Inteligence. I researched topics in multilabel classification, video captioning, occluded regions segmentation, few-shot learning.
Recently I have been researching graph neural networks and particularly how to design methods that take advantage of the relations in the video data and process them in a structured way and how to describe the long range connections of such methods.
You can check out my CV
summary:
I am interested in deep learning methods with a focus on relational representations and graph neural networds. I studied at University Politehnica of Bucharest, where I obtained a Bachelor's degree and a Master's degree in Artificial Inteligence. I researched topics in multilabel classification, video captioning, occluded regions segmentation, few-shot learning.
Recently I have been researching graph neural networks and particularly how to design methods that take advantage of the relations in the video data and process them in a structured way and how to describe the long range connections of such methods.
title: Andrei Liviu Nicolicioiu
Effective Receptive Field of Graph Neural Networks

summary: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) 2019
title: Recurrent Space Time Graph Neural Networks
Mining for Meaning: From Vision to Language Through Multiple Network Consensus

authors: Master's Thesis - UPB. Advised by Prof. Marius Leordeanu
summary: Study language reconstruction from keywords and investigate the transferring of the models towards video captioning. Create a method of ranking sentences that better describe a video.
title: Describing videos in natural language

summary: We studied recurrent models for multi-label prediction from frame features and the effect of global context. We investigated the usage of the labels correlation matrix before the final network prediction, in order to select the strongest cluster of labels.
title: Multi-label classification in video

authors: Bachelor's Thesis - UPB. Advised by Prof. Marius Leordeanu
summary: Developed a method for detecting occluded zones in a video using a fully convolutional model with three branches for multi-model input, with feature alignment by optical flow. The resulting segmentation maps are refined by a second, more localised convolutional network.
title: Deep Occlusion Region Detection in Video
